title: Model Driven (Reactive Forms):
contents:
Model Driven (Reactive Forms):link

Multiselect can be used with reactive forms as well. Just create a simple formControl form variable and use it on form, you can apply all kind of validations over it.

<ngx-multiselect ngDefaultCOntrol [formControl]="selectedOption" [options]="options"> </ngx-multiselect>

Demolink

<p>Select your favourite teams from the following</p> <ngx-multiselect [formControl]="selectedOptions" ngDefaultControl [options]="options" [multiple]="true"> </ngx-multiselect> import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; import { FormControl } from '@angular/forms'; @Component({ selector: 'ms-model-driven', templateUrl: './model-driven.component.html' }) export class ModelDrivenComponent implements OnInit { options; selectedOptions; constructor() {} ngOnInit(): void { this.options = [ { "id": 1, "name": "Manchester United" }, { "id": 2, "name": "Liverpool F.C." }, { "id": 3, "name": "Chelsea F.C." }, { "id": 4, "name": "Arsenal F.C." }, { "id": 5, "name": "FC Barcelona" } ]; this.selectedOptions = new FormControl([ { "id": 2, "name": "Liverpool F.C." }, { "id": 3, "name": "Chelsea F.C." } ]); } }

We can also use multiselect formControl inside formGroup/formArray. Demonstration of formGroup consist of inputs, button, checkbox, etc.
